properties.query:
DeviceNetworkEvents
| where RemoteIP == "104.41.203.0"
| where ActionType == "ConnectionSuccess"
| where InitiatingProcessFolderPath startswith "c:\\windows\\system32\\windowspowershell\\v1.0"
| where InitiatingProcessCommandLine contains "-encodedCommand"
| where DeviceName == "adfs01.seccxp.ninja"
| extend DestinationIPAddress = RemoteIP, HostName = "adfs01", DnsDomain = "seccxp.ninja", NetBiosName = "ADFS01.seccxp.ninja", SentBytes = 22545, DeviceAction = "accept", DeviceVendor = "Fortinet"
| project TimeGenerated, DestinationIPAddress, HostName, DnsDomain, NetBiosName, SentBytes, RemotePort
properties.displayName: AUTO DISABLED Fortinet - Data transfer to IP address matched in Threat Intelligence
properties.description: The alert rule was disabled due to too many consecutive failures. Reason: Server is failing to execute the query of this rule, please verify the query. Fortinet data saw a machine in your environment connecting to an IP Address that was matched against Threat Intelligence and associated data transfer. This network connection should be considered suspicious.
